msContents.summary:
A fundamental and very popular sūtra on various topics of mahāyāna Buddhism (philosophy, medicine, legends, dhāraṇīs etc.), dating to no later than the early 5th century CE. In Nepal it is considered to be one of the nine dharmas. According to the colophon, this manuscript was written in the late 18th century in Kathmandu during the reign of Raṇa Bahādur Shah (1775–1805), and commissioned by a certain Dhālasika
as an object of worship.

msItem.author: ‏Unknown .
msItem.title: Suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtra
Suvarṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarāja
Suvarṇabhāsottamasūtra
Suvarṇaprabhāsa
msItem.rubric: [1v1] $ oṃ namaḥ śrīsarvabuddhabodhisattvebhyaḥ || namaḥ śrībhagavatyai ā¦[space left blank for a miniature]ryaprajñāpāramitāyai || tadyathā || śrutismṛtigativijaye svā[1v2]hā ||
msItem.incipit: [1v2] śrutaṃ mayaikasamaye gṛddhrakūṭe tathāgataḥ vijahāra dharmmadhā¦[space left blank for a miniature]tau gaṃbhīre buddhagocare || bodhisatvasamuccayayā mahākuladevatayā sa[1v3]sarasvatyā ca mahādevatayā śriyā ca mahādevatayā | dṛḍhayā ca mahāpṛthi [space left blank for a miniature] vīdevatayā hārītyā ca mahādevatayā evaṃ pramukhābhir mahādevatā[1v4]bhir anekedevanāgayakṣarākṣasagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramaho[space left blank for a miniature]ragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ sārddham || athāyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad a[1v5]vocat_ || kiṃ tusāṃ ca bhagavan dharmavinayaṃ bhaviṣyatīti | bhagavānā[space left blank for a miniature]ha || gāthābhi bhānaṃ ca na duḥpṛcchayā virajaskaṃ samādhiṃ dharmasāraṃ pra¦[2r1]ṣṭhitam || śuddheṣu virajaskeṣu bodhisatvottameṣu ca | nidānaṃ sūtrarājendrasvarṇṇaprabhāsottamam idam |
msItem.finalRubric: [18v1] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottamasūtrendrarāje kamalākaro nāma sarvvatathāgatastavaparivartto nāma paṃcamaḥ || @ ||
[46v4] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje śrīmahādevīparivartto ¦ [46v5] nāma navamaḥ || @ ||
[47r3] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje sarvvabuddha[47r4]bodhisatvanāma saṃdhāraniparivartto daśamaḥ | @ ||
[51r2] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāja dṛḍāpṛthivīdevatā parivartto nāmaikādaśaḥ || @ ||
[52v5] || @ || [53r1] iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje sañjāyaparivartto nāma dvādaśaḥ || @ ||
[57r3] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje devendrasamayaṃ nāma rājaśāstraparivarttas trayodaśa || @ ||
[59r5] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje susaṃmbhavaparivartto nāmaś caturdaśaḥ || @ ||
[66r2] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje daśadevapu[66r3]trasahasrāṇi vyākaraṇāparivarttaḥ ṣoḍāśaḥ || @ ||
[69v1] || @ || iti śrīsuvarṇṇaprabhāsottame sūtrendrarāje vyādhipraśamanaparivartto nāma saptadaśa[69v2]ḥ || @ ||
msItem.explicit: [89v5] atha bhagavān āsanād utthāya brahmasvareṇāvocat_ | sādhu sādhu te kuladevate śāstā dadāmi sādhu te kuladevate punaś ca sā¦[90r1]dhvīti || @ || idam avocat_ bhagavān āttamanās te ca bodhisatvā bodhisatvasamuccayā kuladevatāsarasvatīmahādevīpramukhā sā ca sarvvāvatī parṣadasuragaruḍakinnaramahoragādi¦[90r2]pramukhā bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandann iti || @ ||
msItem.colophon: [90r2] ye dharmmā hetuprabhavā hetu teṣān tathāgatahy avada[90r3]t teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha e || @ || vaṃvadī mahāśramaṇaḥ || @ || yad atra puṇyaṃ tad bhavatv ācāryopādhyāya,mātā pitṛpūrvvaṅgamaṃ kṛtvā, vāramukundapramukhādīnāṃ sakalasatvarāśer anuttarajñāna[90r4]samyaksaṃbodhipadaṃ prāptayeti || @ || svasti śrīgirirājacakracūḍāmaṇinaranārāyaṇetyādi, vividhavirūḍāvalī virājamānamānonāta, nepāleśvara, śrīmanmahārāja hindu¦[90r5]patibātsāha, śrī śrī śrī raṇabahādūra sāha, bahādūra samaserajaṃgadevānāṃ sadāsamaravijayināṃ, vijayarājya || @ || śrūtīndunaṃde, yutahāyane smin tayāvadāte, tithirāma[90v1]candre, tiṣyāḍūvāyāṃ, budhavāsare ca, sūre ca kumbhe śaśi krarkkaṭāstha || @ || dānapati kāntipūramahānagare, kamilāśchitola, dhālasiko nāma gṛhādhivāsita, puṇyātmā:[90v2]tulādhara, bāla mukunda, sahodara, bhātṛ, bhājudaṃ, putra, jayapatāpasiṃ, pitāmahi, jayalakṣmī, mātā, ratnavati, dārā, jagalakṣmī,, ete sahānumaṃtena,, śrī 3 suvarṇṇaprabhāsottama[90v3]mahāsutrendrarājapustaka jambunandana, cūrṇṇena likhāpayitvā, pratiṣṭhāpitam abhūt_ || @ || atha deśabhākhā || dānapatikāntipūramahānagara, kamilācchitola, dhvākā¦[90v4]siyā, takhāccheyā, dhālasiko sacophakṣma, tulādhara bāla mukunda, bhātṛ, bhājudaṃ, putra, jayapatāpasiṃ, pitāmahi, jayalakṣmī, mātā, ratnavati,, patni,, jagalakṣmi,, thva¦ [90v5] tiparivāracchiyāṃ, dhamī citnajūyāḍo, śrī 3 suvarṇṇaprabhāsa-1-racocakaṃ dayakā, divaṃgata, pitā, bālagvavindayā nāmata, luyāmahāmañjuśrīpratimā dayakā, śrī 3

supportDesc.support:
Nepalese multi-layered black paper.
8.3 33.7
The last folio is blank and slightly smaller:
8.2 30.1

layoutDesc.layout:
ca 3.7 ca 27-29
The written area is smaller than the area demarcated by the frame.
5 lines per page, approximately 65 akṣaras per line.
5
2
The frame has been singled out by glazing the paper. Triple marginal frame lines in golden ink, ruling.
ca 4.5-5 ca 27.6-30
The puṣpikās are always in the form a small circle.

decoNote.desc: On folio 1 verso the space for a miniature has been left blank, and is delimited by triple lines identical to the marginal frame lines.

item.marginalia: On the bottom right margin of folio 61r5, two akṣaras missing in the main text have been supplied by the scribe, together with a reference sign repeated in the main text.

bindingDesc.p: On the outside of the back cover, traces of materials smeared on the manuscript during worship rites.

history.origin:
914 Nepāla / 1794 CE.
The date is given in the colophon with the bhūtasaṅkhyā-system (śrūtīndunaṃde: nanda, the nine Magadhan kings, indu, the moon (= one) and śruti, the four Vedas). Nepal, Kathmandu (Kāntipura).
history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1873-6.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card for admissions procedures contact Cambridge University Library Admissions).
